text.calc: 00000001#External Class Editor00000000#This example demonstrates how to implement an alternative class editor, in this case for Schema Classes.The editor named 'My Schema Editor' is installed on the Tools|Add-Ons menu on startup and is used instead of the default Schema editor by classes whose $editor property is set to 'MYEDITOR'.Any classes created or modified using this editor automatically have $editor set to this value.In addition, the property $editordata is used to save the window setup.The editor provides the user with advanced functionality to store additional character data in $userinfo for each column and row data in $userinfo for the class.Set show_properties in your config.json file to show the hidden properties $editor and $editordata in your Property Manager.
